column1: The Pit Room////After talking this place up with friends and family for two months I made it back here with a group of friends including an out of town-er only to have the place not live up to my own hype. Yeah
column3: but not as great. Mainly the brisket was dry and all gray without much of a smoke ring. This is just a straight up fail when you are taking a half dozen people to have "great Texas BBQ." Everyone enjoyed their meal
column4: but no one was wowed including myself. Looks like I won't be coming back or recommending this place for a while as I try to get the egg of my face. $17 for a 4 star BBQ plate just isn't worth it... for this flavor and dryness of brisket I can go to half a dozen other places for cheaper.
